attributes.overallObjectives: This advanced course explores the fundamental principles of quantum mechanics and their applications in modern physics. Students will develop a deep understanding of quantum phenomena through mathematical analysis and experimental observations. The course combines theoretical physics with practical laboratory work to demonstrate quantum effects and their technological applications.
classObjectives: Week 1 | Quantum Foundations: Review wave-particle duality and uncertainty principle
Week 2 | Wave Functions: Master Schr√∂dinger equation and probability interpretations
Week 3 | Quantum States: Analyze spin systems and quantum superposition
Week 4 | Quantum Tunneling: Study barrier penetration and applications
Week 5 | Quantum Computing: Explore qubits and quantum algorithms
Week 6 | Entanglement: Investigate quantum correlations and EPR paradox
Week 7 | Applications: Study quantum cryptography and teleportation
Week 8 | Final Project: Design quantum physics experiment
